A Feast for Crows

October 4th, 2007 · 1 Comment

I started reading George R.R. Martin’s A Feast for Crows, the fourth book in his epic fantasy series and gave up after 90 pages. At that point I realized I still had no idea who any of the characters were and didn’t see any way I could come up to speed on the characters without rereading the entire series.

Here’s a tip: if your 4th book is many years in the making, runs at 800 pages and has a character index of 50 pages, you need to include a story summary to remind your readers of what happened in the previous three books so we can follow the happenings!!!

Tags: General
